quotes: Since 2006 we have worked in solidarity with women's movements, organizations, and activists around the world to build peace, defend justice, and champion equality for all.
Tawakkol Karman was known as “The Mother of the Revolution” and was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2011 in recognition of her work in nonviolent struggle for women’s rights and democracy in Yemen.
Tawakkol was born in 1979 in Taiz, Yemen’s third largest city.

Growing up in a politically tumultuous country, Tawakkol witnessed the unification of North and South Yemen in 1990, followed by a civil war between the two factions in 1994 in which the North triumphed over the South.

awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2011 in recognition of her work in nonviolent struggle for women’s rights and democracy in Yemen.
